pageContext.claim: “If you own a house within vision of some of these monsters [referring to windmills], your house is worth 50 percent of the price. They're noisy. They kill the birds. You want to see a bird graveyard? You just go. Take a look. A bird graveyard. Go under a windmill someday.”
pageContext.analysis: This is a big stretch. Some research shows that property values decline due to proximity to wind turbines, but it's nowhere near Trump's estimated decline. A London School of Economics study found that property values declined "5-6% on average for housing with a visible wind farm within 2 km, falling to under 2% between 2-4km, and to near zero between 8-14 km, which is at the limit of likely visibility."
